User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/534.24 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/11.0.696.65 Safari/534.24
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

There are font rendering issues when using 3rd party visual styles. Here are some examples.

This is what the context menu looks like under chrome: http://localhostr.com/files/4D4jYiY/chrome.png

This is what it looks like under firefox4:
http://localhostr.com/files/aJzi1cS/fx.png

This also occurs on certain websites.  I find that websites with backgrounds causes the bad font rendering. You can see it clearly on these sites: http://www.apocalyptica.de/forum/wbb/index.php?page=Board&boardID=5&s=f9427e88a7af7d8b49c4ad4ec16266f585843793 and http://www.reddit.com/r/fffffffuuuuuuuuuuuu/

Here are some examples with the text zoomed in.

Under Chrome: http://localhostr.com/files/unfOhB0/chromesite.png
Under Fx4: http://localhostr.com/files/ZZ3b0AS/fxsite.png

This only occurs with 3rd party visual styles installed.  The fonts look normal under Aero, Basic, or classic.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use a 3rd party Visual Style (http://browse.deviantart.com/customization/skins/windows7/visualstyle/)
2. Open a menu or context menu in firefox
3.

Actual Results:  
You will see the bad font rendering.

Expected Results:  
It should render the font correctly like everything else on your OS.

comments.raw_text: That looks like grayscale vs subpixel antialiasing, which can happen if your third-party visual style doesn't use opaque backgrounds...

comments.raw_text:
It might be fixable.

I bet these visual styles are returning "transparent" for all their theme parts.

Does Windows support transparent menus via these third-party visual styles? If not, we can hardcode the menu transparency. If it does, I wonder how other apps draw text on those menus.

Sorry I think my last comment was wrong and that context menu transparency is not possible without a separate app.  However I have found a VS that actually has normal menus under Fx4: http://minimizewindows7.deviantart.com/art/Stealth-1-78-207271044

Possibly due to it not returning "transparent" for its theme parts as you hypothesized.

They're pretty rare though as this is the first one I've run into.
